intro: Astrotricha linearis, commonly known as the slender star-leaf, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive and ecologically valuable addition to native plant gardens.
